Currently there are 2 prefs to control whether decoded images should be discarded and how long will it take:
image.mem.discardable
image.mem.min_discard_timeout_ms
When I set "image.mem.discardable" to "false", the decoded images "in background tab" will not be discarded, this is what I wanted, but when I close the tab ,they also can't be discared. "image.mem.min_discard_timeout_ms" is the same.
here is my problem, take this page for example
http://warezforum.info/300mb-movies/1828420-my-huge-300mb-600mb-movies-collection.html
when you fully open it, memory usage will increase about 100mb, when you switch to other tabs for a while (now only need 10s) then switch back, Fx will freeze for a second before responding, imagine you opened 5 pages like that, every time you switch tabs Fx freezes a second, how annoying will it be! but only 500mb memory consumption is well within your acceptable range.
When you put a tab in background, means you will view it later, means it's still of value, but when you close it, means it's out of its usefulness, means it's done. treating them exactly the same is unreasonable.
There should be 4 prefs to handle them:
image.mem.closed_iscardable
image.mem.min_iscardable
image.mem.close_discard_timeout_ms
image.mem.min_discard_timeout_ms

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: bgdistance@yahoo.com

comments.text:
When I was finally fed up with the frozenness when switching tabs, I decided to set "image.mem.discardable" to "false" no matter what, than I discovered this "trick" which is "closing one more tab". Fx simply won't discard the tab you just closed.
Don't laugh, it "solved" my problem, though it's not the ideal way, but what can I do?
